The lunar samples Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrin collected during their time spent on the surface of the Moon during the #Apollo11 mission were the first samples returned to earth from another celestial body. We‚Äôre still studying these samples today! #Apollo50th

The Apollo 11 astronauts were isolated for 21 days after returning to earth to prevent the potential spread of lunar contagions. The crew spent the first few days in a converted Airstream trailer before arriving at NASA's main quarantine facility. #Apollo50th

650 million people were able to hear Neil Armstrong‚Äôs famous line, ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs one small step for a man, one giant leap for mankind,‚Äù thanks to the communications system called the Deep Space Network. #Apollo50th

Neil Armstrong had to improvise the landing after the lunar module disconnected from the command module with too much force. Armstrong managed to manually land the module in the Sea of Tranquility with seconds of fuel supply left, announcing ‚Äúthe Eagle has landed.‚Äù #Apollo50th

50 years ago today, #Apollo11‚Äôs lunar lander touched down on the surface on the moon and broke loose the bonds of America‚Äôs scientific imagination. Some 400,000 of our greatest scientists, inventors, engineers & mathematicians had opened the door to the universe. #Apollo50th #OTD
